Description: Neck sherd of Attic West Slope black-glazed pottery amphora; interior black; exterior black with garland of leaves around neck in added white and yellow; below at right, part of undetermined pendent motif in added white; below modelled junction of neck and shoulder, traces of undetermined decoration in added white.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 61, pl. 40, no. 7)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (ID.045)
